member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem
member.summary: This class contains all data important to define an item stored in the cache. It holds both the key and value specified by the user, as well as housekeeping information used internally by this block. It is public, rather than internal, to allow block extenders access to it inside their own implementations of IBackingStore.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemPriority,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemRefreshAction,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemExpiration[])
member.summary: Constructs a fully formed CacheItem.
member.param: Key identifying this CacheItem
Value to be stored. May be null.
Scavenging priority of CacheItem. See for values.
Object supplied by caller that will be invoked upon expiration of the CacheItem. May be null.
Param array of ICacheItemExpiration objects. May provide 0 or more of these.

member.summary: Constructs a fully formed CacheItem. This constructor is to be used when restoring an existing CacheItem from the backing store. As such, it does not generate its own Guid for this instance, but allows the guid to be passed in, as read from the backing store.
member.param: Time this CacheItem last accessed by user.
Key provided by the user for this cache item. May not be null.
Value to be stored. May be null.
Scavenging priority of CacheItem. See for values.
Object supplied by caller that will be invoked upon expiration of the CacheItem. May be null.
Param array of ICacheItemExpiration objects. May provide 0 or more of these.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem.Replace(System.Object,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemRefreshAction,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemPriority,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemExpiration[])
member.summary: Replaces the internals of the current cache item with the given new values. This is strictly used in the Cache class when adding a new item into the cache. By replacing the item's contents, rather than replacing the item itself, it allows us to keep a single reference in the cache, simplifying locking.
member.param: Value to be stored. May be null.
Scavenging priority of CacheItem. See for values.
Object supplied by caller that will be invoked upon expiration of the CacheItem. May be null.
Param array of ICacheItemExpiration objects. May provide 0 or more of these.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem.HasExpired
member.summary: Evaluates all expirations associated with this cache item to determine if it should be considered expired. Evaluation stops as soon as any expiration returns true.
member.returns: True if item should be considered expired, according to policies defined in this item's expirations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem.TouchedByUserAction(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Intended to be used internally only. This method is called whenever a CacheItem is touched through the action of a user. It prevents this CacheItem from being expired or scavenged during an in-progress expiration or scavenging process. It has no effect on subsequent expiration or scavenging processes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem.TouchedByUserAction(System.Boolean,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Intended to be used internally only. This method is called whenever a CacheItem is touched through the action of a user. It prevents this CacheItem from being expired or scavenged during an in-progress expiration or scavenging process. It has no effect on subsequent expiration or scavenging processes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemRefreshAction
member.summary: This interface defines the contract that must be implemented to create an object that can be used to refresh an expired item from the cache. The implementing class must be serializable. Care must be taken when implementing this interface not to create an object that maintains too much state about its environment, as all portions of its environment will be serialized as well, creating possibly a huge object graph.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemRefreshAction.Refresh(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason)
member.summary: Called when an item expires from the cache. This method can be used to notify an application that the expiration occured, cause the item to be refetched and refreshed from its original location, or perform any other application-specific action.
member.param: Key of item removed from cache. Will never be null.
Value from cache item that was just expired
Reason the item was removed from the cache. See
member.remarks: This method should catch and handle any exceptions thrown during its operation. No exceptions should leak out of it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager
member.summary: This class represents the interface to caching as shown to the user. All caching operations are performed through this class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if key refers to item current stored in cache
member.param: Key of item to check for
member.returns: True if item referenced by key is in the cache

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds new CacheItem to cache. If another item already exists with the same key, that item is removed before the new item is added. If any failure occurs during this process, the cache will not contain the item being added. Items added with this method will be not expire, and will have a Normal priority.
member.param: Identifier for this CacheItem
Value to be stored in cache. May be null.
member.exception: Provided key is an empty string
member.remarks: The CacheManager can be configured to use different storage mechanisms in which to store the CacheItems. Each of these storage mechanisms can throw exceptions particular to their own implementations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.Add(System.String,System.Object,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemPriority,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemRefreshAction,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheItemExpiration[])
member.summary: Adds new CacheItem to cache. If another item already exists with th esame key, that item is removed before the new item is added. If any failure occurs during this process, the cache will not contain the item being added.
member.param: Identifier for this CacheItem
Value to be stored in cache. May be null.
Specifies the new item's scavenging priority. See for more information.
Object provided to allow the cache to refresh a cache item that has been expired. May be null.
Param array specifying the expiration policies to be applied to this item. May be null or omitted.
member.exception: Provided key is an empty string
member.remarks: The CacheManager can be configured to use different storage mechanisms in which to store the CacheItems. Each of these storage mechanisms can throw exceptions particular to their own implementations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the given item from the cache. If no item exists with that key, this method does nothing.
member.param: Key of item to remove from cache.
member.exception: Provided key is an empty string
member.remarks: The CacheManager can be configured to use different storage mechanisms in which to store the CacheItems. Each of these storage mechanisms can throw exceptions particular to their own implementations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.GetData(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value associated with the given key.
member.param: Key of item to return from cache.
member.returns: Value stored in cache
member.exception: Provided key is an empty string
member.remarks: The CacheManager can be configured to use different storage mechanisms in which to store the CacheItems. Each of these storage mechanisms can throw exceptions particular to their own implementations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheManager.Flush
member.summary: Removes all items from the cache. If an error occurs during the removal, the cache is left unchanged.
member.remarks: The CacheManager can be configured to use different storage mechanisms in which to store the CacheItems. Each of these storage mechanisms can throw exceptions particular to their own implementations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.IBackingStore

summary.P: This interface defines the contract that must be implemented by all backing stores. Implementors of this method are responsible for interacting with their underlying persistence mechanisms to store and retrieve CacheItems. All methods below must guarantee Weak Exception Safety. This means that operations must complete entirely, or them must completely clean up from the failure and leave the cache in a consistent state. The mandatory cleanup process will remove all traces of the item that caused the failure, causing that item to be expunged from the cache entirely.

member.remarks: Do to the way the Caching class is implemented, implementations of this class will always be called in a thread-safe way. There is no need to make these classes thread-safe on its own.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.IBackingStore.Add(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItem)

summary.p: This method is responsible for adding a CacheItem to the BackingStore. This operation must be successful even if an item with the same key already exists. This method must also meet the Weak Exception Safety guarantee and remove the item from the backing store if any part of the Add fails.

member.param: CacheItem to be added

remarks.p: Other exceptions can be thrown, depending on what individual Backing Store implementations throw during Add

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.IBackingStore.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an item with the given key from the backing store
member.param: Key to remove. Must not be null.

remarks.p: Other exceptions can be thrown, depending on what individual Backing Store implementations throw during Remove

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.IBackingStore.UpdateLastAccessedTime(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Updates the last accessed time for a cache item.
member.param: Key to update
Time at which item updated

remarks.p: Other exceptions can be thrown, depending on what individual Backing Store implementations throw during UpdateLastAccessedTime

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.IBackingStore.Flush
member.summary: Flushes all CacheItems from backing store. This method must meet the Weak Exception Safety guarantee.

remarks.p: Other exceptions can be thrown, depending on what individual Backing Store implementations throw during Flush

member.summary: Loads all CacheItems from backing store.
member.returns: Hashtable filled with all existing CacheItems.

remarks.p: Other exceptions can be thrown, depending on what individual Backing Store implementations throw during Load

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Cache
member.summary: The real worker of the block. The Cache class is the traffic cop that prevents resource contention among the different threads in the system. It also will act as the remoting gateway when that feature is added to the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.ICacheOperations
member.summary: Summary description for ICacheOperations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Cache.RemoveItemFromCache(System.String,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason)
member.devdoc: This seemingly redundant method is here to be called through the ICacheOperations interface. I put this in place to break any dependency from any other class onto the Cache class

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Cache.Flush
member.devdoc: There may still be thread safety issues in this class with respect to expirations and scavenging, but I really doubt that either of those will be happening while a Flush is in progress. It seems that the most likely scenario for a flush to be called is at the very start of a program, or when absolutely nothing else is going on. Calling flush in the middle of an application would seem to be an "interesting" thing to do in normal circumstances.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.BackingStoreImplementations.IsolatedStorageBackingStore
member.summary: Implementation of IBackingStore that stores its CacheItems into IsolatedStorage.
member.remarks: This class assumes a tree-structured storage schema. Each named instance of an Isolated Storage area creates a separate, top-level directory in Isolated Storage. This is to allow a user to segregate different areas in IsoStore to allow multiple applications to use their own logically separate areas. Inside each of these areas, each CacheItem is stored in its own subdirectory, with separate files in those subdirectories representing the different pieces of a CacheItem. The item was split like this to allow for several optimizations. The first optimization is that now, the essence of a CacheItem can be restored indepedently of the underlying value. It is the deserialization of the value object that could conceivably be very time consuming, so by splitting it off into its own file, that deserialization process could be delayed until the value is actually needed. The second optimization is that we are now able to update the last accessed time for a CacheItem without to bring the entire CacheItem into memory, make the update, and then reserialize it.

summary.p: This method is responsible for adding a CacheItem to the BackingStore. This operation must be successful even if an item with the same key already exists. This method must also meet the exception safety guarantee and make sure that all traces of the new or old item are gone if the add fails in any way.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheFactory
member.summary: Static factory class used to get instances of a specified CacheManager

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheFactory.GetCacheManager
member.summary: Returns the default CacheManager instance. The same instance should be returned each time this method is called. The name of the instance to treat as the default CacheManager is defined in the configuration file. Guaranteed to return an intialized CacheManager if no exception thrown
member.returns: Default cache manager instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheFactory.GetCacheManager(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the named CacheManager instance. Guaranteed to return an initialized CacheManager if no exception thrown.
member.param: Name defined in configuration for the cache manager to instantiate
member.returns: The requested CacheManager instance.
member.exception: Could not find instance specified in cacheManagerName
Error processing configuration information defined in application configuration file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Instrumentation.CachingServiceItemTurnoverEvent

summary.para: This type supports the Instrumentation infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.devdoc: Instrumentation event called when the items in cache change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Instrumentation.CachingServiceItemTurnoverEvent.FireAddItems(System.Int64)
member.devdoc: Fires event when an item is added to the cache with the number of item added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Instrumentation.CachingServiceItemTurnoverEvent.FireRemoveItems(System.Int64)
member.devdoc: Fires event when an item is removed from the cache with the number of items removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.Instrumentation.CachingServiceItemTurnoverEvent.SetItemsTotal(System.Int64)
member.devdoc: Sets the total number of items in the cache

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason
member.summary: The reason that the cache item was removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason.Expired
member.summary: The item has expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason.Removed
member.summary: The item was manually removed from the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason.Scavenged
member.summary: The item was removed by the scavenger because it had a lower priority that any other item in the cache.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.Caching.CacheItemRemovedReason.Unknown
member.summary: Reserved. Do not use.
